name: NPR
text:
A growing list of attendees to a reception for the president's Supreme Court nominee have tested positive for coronavirus.

But on Thursday, Trump suggested he may have been infected the following day — at a reception for families of fallen troops. 
https://t.co/E8ZusfvfcS

name: NPR
text:
A single gunshot. A rising star. A 30-year sentence. When No Limit’s fallen soldier Mac Phipps was accused of murder, his rap dreams became a nightmare. But did he do it?

@louderthanariot uncovers layers of corruption in the Louisiana justice system. https://t.co/Sob4pp14Kd

name: NPR
text:
NEW: The Supreme Court has refused for now to reimpose FDA regulations that require people seeking medication abortion to pick up prescribed pills in-person at a clinic instead of by mail.
https://t.co/aO5pt7Z4du

name: NPR
text: RT @alanawise_: Democrats on Thursday made clear they felt President Trump was at least in part to blame for a thwarted scheme to kidnap the gov of Michigan, citing the president's divisive rhetoric that has often found support among white supremacists and hate groups.  https://t.co/cpdFBmv4Do

name: NPR
text:
NEW: The Trump campaign is calling for next week's presidential debate to be held in person in Miami — despite the organizing commission's decision to hold it virtually "to protect the health and safety of all involved." 
https://t.co/PW1EaeypqY

name: NPR
text:
hi *taps mic* here is everything you need to know about your state's mail-in voting rules and deadlines.
https://t.co/XO2c6zkl2x

name: NPR
text:
RT @davidfolkenflik: News — 

Lawsuit Alleges Trump-Appointed USAGM CEO Broke Laws In Seeking To Steer VOA Coverage 

First on NPR https://t.co/ZxioPcq5Hn

name: NPR
text:
Nearly all of President Trump's climate rollbacks have been challenged — and several are likely headed to the Supreme Court.

If Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed, it could have a major impact on the government's ability to fight climate change.
https://t.co/DqeaTdVoxK

name: NPR
text:
The Saudi government continues to track down and threaten its critics and dissidents as far as Canada and the U.S., researchers say. The efforts include hacking into cellphones and arresting people's relatives back home.
https://t.co/iSq916zD2h

name: NPR
text: RT @NinaTotenberg: #SCOTUS punts in abortion pill case, temporarily allowing women seeking medication abortions to have prescribed pills sent to them by mail during the pandemic. https://t.co/0uAnV3eMqq

name: NPR
text:
In a leaked letter to CDC Director Robert Redfield, a former director of the agency calls the U.S. response to the pandemic “a slaughter” — and says Redfield “accepted the White House orders without sufficient resistance.”
https://t.co/T31VH1bVRI

name: NPR
text:
Singapore plans to launch cruises again next month — but with one caveat: there's no destination. 

The ships will set sail, then simply return to the port they came from.
https://t.co/qKpJ5yq6Dl

name: NPR
text:
Many of the approximately 300 lawsuits filed this year over voting rules have been settled. 

But some key legal battles remain unresolved — and they could have a big impact on voting in the weeks leading up to Election Day.
https://t.co/raBZ8BYT6n

name: NPR
text:
Michigan's attorney general warns that American extremist ideology is on the rise. "This effort to have a mass uprising nationally is something that we should be very concerned about," she said.
https://t.co/Y5HC5hPkdm

name: NPR
text:
Eating healthy doesn’t mean you have to buy foods with labels like “organic” or “non-GMO.” Frozen and canned foods are your friends. They last longer and are a cheaper alternative to fresh produce. 

More tips for eating on a budget from @NPRLifeKit:
 https://t.co/q906CkfvQK

name: NPR
text:
President Trump continues to tout the experimental antibodies he received for COVID-19 as a "cure" for the disease — despite an absence of evidence to back up that claim.
https://t.co/gBxYp6ARDv

name: NPR
text:
"If you don't really mind if you are winning or losing, you enjoy the play ..." says Rubik's cube inventor Ernő Rubik. "I learn most from my failures — that is the way to learn, that is the way to be successful."
https://t.co/1gHfoSVFwz

name: NPR
text:
You might've hoped the pandemic would cancel sick season — but the annual arrival of allergies, colds and flu is still right on schedule in the U.S.

Here are a few steps to improve your chances of staying healthy:
https://t.co/9pRA5U4PB8

name: NPR
text:
With less than a month to go in the election, an electoral map analysis finds Joe Biden leading President Trump, 290-163.

But it should be noted: Trump remains within striking distance, especially in the Sun Belt states.
https://t.co/V9bm1AVwyU

name: NPR
text: The 2020 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to the World Food Programme, for "acting as a driving force in efforts to prevent the use of hunger as a weapon of war and conflict." https://t.co/QIh5IwBP4j

name: NPR
text:
Retired four-star Air Force Gen. Chuck Boyd is one of hundreds of military voices endorsing Joe Biden for president.

Boyd, who fought in Vietnam and spent 7 years as a prisoner of war, says a second Trump term would be a danger to democracy.
https://t.co/rTP11fr0Is

name: NPR
text:
Hurricane Delta will bring a "life-threatening storm surge, destructive winds, and significant flooding" to the Gulf Coast, the National Weather Service says.

The storm is forecast to make landfall this evening.
https://t.co/5sELVT5pXM

name: NPR
text:

When No Limit’s fallen soldier Mac Phipps was accused of murder, his rap dreams became a nightmare. But did he do it?

name: NPR
NPR
text:
When a firestorm swept through the town of Malden, most residents — who skew older and lower income — lost their homes. The post office, town hall, library, fire station and food bank were all leveled. 

Residents say it's a miracle no one died.
https://t.co/yb54pWgVoB

name: NPR
text:
More than 7.6 million cases of the coronavirus have been identified in the U.S., and more than 212,000 people have died.

Here are the latest figures for each state.
https://t.co/7q7BjhRgGy

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRGoatsandSoda: A single mom who lost her job. A powerful health official. A rap impresario in Wuhan. A teenage ice skater. 

Our special "Women in the Pandemic" project looks at how the women of the world are facing the coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/tQ9UMZyGF4

name: NPR
text:
Life is hard for everyone during a pandemic. But in a global crisis, women often carry extra burdens.

From a single mom who lost her job to Iceland's top health official, meet 19 women who're drawing upon their inner strength to survive — and even thrive: https://t.co/x8MYyE82nW

name: NPR
text:
Of the 37 coronavirus cases among White House staff and contacts, 11 are linked to a Rose Garden event.

But the White House isn't even trying to contact trace the outbreak related to that event because it took place over 48 hours before Trump's diagnosis. https://t.co/N3WWyYJ6Lw

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer: "When our leaders meet with, encourage, or fraternize with domestic terrorists, they legitimize their actions, and they are complicit. When they stoke and contribute to hate speech, they are complicit." https://t.co/OHVR24Mc9h

name: NPR
text:
Jack White will perform as SNL's musical guest this weekend — a last-minute replacement after country singer Morgan Wallen was dismissed for not following coronavirus safety protocols.
https://t.co/DeKEVTkrLM

name: NPR
text:
President Trump plans to deliver remarks on Saturday at an outdoor event. It's his first public event since being hospitalized for the coronavirus.

The White House declined to say whether he has tested negative. https://t.co/ULNY55M2wc

name: NPR
text: The 2020 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to the World Food Programme for "acting as a driving force in efforts to prevent the use of hunger as a weapon of war and conflict." https://t.co/TVYvKZKEK5

name: NPR
text:
Twitter is announcing new rules aimed at fighting election misinformation.

The platform says it'll more aggressively limit the impact of misleading posts — and hide tweets containing false claims from U.S. political figures behind a warning screen.
https://t.co/82TuhboA2r

name: NPR
text:
The legendary New York Yankees pitcher Whitey Ford, whose dominance during the 1950s and 1960s helped cement the team as perennial champions, has died at the age of 91.
https://t.co/R63Rt0LHI8

name: NPR
text: RT @ayesharascoe: Yeah, those were my kids screaming in background and there was an ice cream truck playing music! Happy Friday everyone! https://t.co/PO3dBoUOzF

name: NPR
text:
Public school enrollment has been trending slowly upward for 15 years. This year, during the pandemic, it seems to be dropping.

And those declines could mean less state funding for school districts.
https://t.co/UWmQBHfmB4
